data.title: Paul Van Zeeland, A Monetary Economist Between Two Worlds: The European Journal of The History of Economic Thought
data.meta_description: 09672567.2020.1746376 - Free download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. This document discusses Paul van Zeeland, a Belgian economist and prime minister, and his development as a monetary economist influenced by both American and European traditions. It describes his education in Belgium where he studied under A.E. Janssen and was exposed to Catholic economic thought. It then discusses his studies at Princeton under E.W. Kemmerer and experience at the New York Federal Reserve. Finally, it analyzes his early career back in Belgium developing stabilization plans for Belgium's economy as a small, open economy influenced by both his American training and Belgian background.
data.text: Paul Van Zeeland, A Monetary Economist Between Two Worlds: The European Journal of The History of Economic Thought
